verses.kjv: And when they came nigh to Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sendeth forth two of his disciples,
verses.ct: As they approached Jerusalem, near Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent 2 of his disciples ahead.

verses.kjv: And saith unto them, Go your way into the village over against you: and as soon as ye be entered into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon never man sat; loose him, and bring him.
verses.ct: He told them, "Go into the village just ahead of you. As soon as you enter it, you'll find a young donkey tied up that no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it back."

verses.kjv: And if any man say unto you, Why do ye this? say ye that the Lord hath need of him; and straightway he will send him hither.
verses.ct: "If anyone asks you, 'Why are you doing that?' just say, 'The Lord needs it,' and they will send it right away."

verses.kjv: And they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met; and they loose him.
verses.ct: So they went and found the young donkey tied up outside a door at a place where 2 roads crossed, and they untied it.

verses.kjv: And certain of them that stood there said unto them, What do ye, loosing the colt?
verses.ct: Some people standing nearby asked them, "What are you doing, untying that donkey?"

verses.kjv: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded: and they let them go.
verses.ct: They answered exactly as Jesus had instructed, and the people let them take it.

verses.kjv: And they brought the colt to Jesus, and cast their garments on him; and he sat upon him.
verses.ct: They brought the young donkey to Jesus and draped their cloaks over it, and he sat on it.

verses.kjv: And many spread their garments in the way: and others cut down branches off the trees, and strawed them in the way.
verses.ct: Many people spread their cloaks on the road, while others cut leafy branches from the trees and scattered them along the path.

verses.kjv: And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord:
verses.ct: The crowds walking in front of him and behind him were shouting, "Hosanna! Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!"

verses.kjv: Blessed be the kingdom of our father David, that cometh in the name of the Lord: Hosanna in the highest.
verses.ct: "Blessed is the coming kingdom of our ancestor David! Hosanna in the highest!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem, and into the temple: and when he had looked round about upon all things, and now the eventide was come, he went out unto Bethany with the twelve.
verses.ct: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple. He looked around at everything, but since it was already evening, he left for Bethany with the 12.

verses.kjv: And on the morrow, when they were come from Bethany, he was hungry:
verses.ct: The next day, as they were leaving Bethany, he was hungry.

verses.kjv: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find any thing thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for the time of figs was not yet.
verses.ct: He noticed a fig tree in the distance that had leaves, so he went over to see if it had any fruit. But when he reached it, he found nothing but leaves, since it wasn't the season for figs.

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto it, No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever. And his disciples heard it.
verses.ct: Jesus said to the tree, "May no one ever eat fruit from you again." His disciples heard him say this.

verses.kjv: And they come to Jerusalem: and Jesus went into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers, and the seats of them that sold doves;
verses.ct: They arrived in Jerusalem, and Jesus went into the temple and started driving out those who were buying and selling there. He flipped over the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those selling doves.

verses.kjv: And would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple.
verses.ct: He also refused to let anyone carry merchandise through the temple.

verses.kjv: And he taught, saying unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer? but ye have made it a den of thieves.
verses.ct: Then he taught them, saying, "Doesn't Scripture say, 'My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations'? But you have turned it into a hideout for criminals."

verses.kjv: And the scribes and chief priests heard it, and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, because all the people was astonished at his doctrine.
verses.ct: The chief priests and the experts in the law heard about this and began looking for a way to kill him. They were afraid of him because the entire crowd was amazed by his teaching.

verses.kjv: And when even was come, he went out of the city.
verses.ct: When evening came, Jesus and his disciples left the city.

verses.kjv: And in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.
verses.ct: The next morning, as they walked by, they saw that the fig tree had completely withered from the roots up.

verses.kjv: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him, Master, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away.
verses.ct: Peter remembered what had happened and said to him, "Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has completely dried up!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering saith unto them, Have faith in God.
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "Put your trust in God."

verses.kjv: For verily I say unto you, That whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoever he saith.
verses.ct: "Truly I tell you, if someone says to this mountain, 'Be lifted up and thrown into the sea,' and doesn't doubt in their heart but believes that what they say will happen, it will be done for them."

verses.kjv: Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.
verses.ct: "That's why I'm telling you: whatever you ask for in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours."

verses.kjv: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.
verses.ct: "And whenever you stand praying, if you're holding something against someone, forgive them, so that your Father in heaven will also forgive your sins."

verses.kjv: But if ye do not forgive, neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses.
verses.ct: "But if you refuse to forgive others, your Father in heaven won't forgive your sins either."

verses.kjv: And they come again to Jerusalem: and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders,
verses.ct: They returned to Jerusalem, and while Jesus was walking through the temple, the chief priests, the experts in the law, and the elders approached him.

verses.kjv: And say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?
verses.ct: They demanded, "What gives you the right to do these things? Who authorized you to act this way?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto them, I will also ask of you one question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Let me ask you one question first. Answer me, and then I'll tell you what authority I have for doing these things."

verses.kjv: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or of men? answer me.
verses.ct: "Was John's baptism from heaven, or was it purely human? Give me your answer."

verses.kjv: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?
verses.ct: They debated among themselves, saying, "If we say it was from heaven, he'll ask, 'Then why didn't you believe him?'"

verses.kjv: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all men counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.
verses.ct: "But if we say it was purely human..." They were afraid of the crowd, because everyone regarded John as a genuine prophet.

verses.kjv: And they answered and said unto Jesus, We cannot tell. And Jesus answering saith unto them, Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.
verses.ct: So they answered Jesus, "We don't know." Jesus said to them, "Then I'm not going to tell you what authority I have for doing these things either."
